content.description: Starts at the far right side of the boulder, hands matching on sloper jug with your feet in the lowest part of the crack. Move left using the crack for your feet and the small crimps, match and set up for a long reach for a hidden hold(Crux). From here move right to top out using the overhanging rocks. Walk off to the right back to main trail.
content.protection: One mat could help, not needed

content.description: Starts with right hand in pocket with the left on a side pull. Move left using low side pulls and feet in crack. Set up for the crux by stepping up with the right foot while holding the “hilt” of the crack, then,dyno or reach depending on height to a final top out jug. Walk off to the left and find a trail back around to the base of the boulder.
content.location: Left of U-Turn in the middle of the wall. Look for the sword shaped crack.

content.description: Starts with right hand in pocket and left on crimpy ledge with the obvious feet. Move left and up the crimpy rail till you reach good hands. Reachy top out with small holds and no feet will let the route name speak for itself.
content.location: Last route on the wall before the dihedral. Starts at the end of the crack.
